etymologies: late 19th century. From energ- + -ism, after German †Energism, Energismus

definitions: Belief that activity is of central importance to life or existence; a theory characterized by this, especially (Ethics) the theory that happiness or the highest good lies in activity which realizes a person's full potential.
The doctrine or theory that changes in energy form the basis of all physical phenomena, and that energy is the fundamental constituent of the universe; = energeticism.
